item.title: Federal Judge Strikes Down Portions Of An Alabama Abortion Law
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Under the law, a minor who didn't have parental consent for an abortion could have faced a legal proceeding involving her parents, the district attorney and a person representing the fetus.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Under the law, a minor who didn't have parental consent for an abortion could have faced a legal proceeding involving her parents, the district attorney and a person representing the fetus. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540932724/federal-judge-strikes-down-portions-of-an-alabama-abortion-law

item.title: A Big Win For Afghan Women's Wheelchair Hoopsters
item.description: August 1, 2017 - The players used to be shy about playing sports as women using wheelchairs. Today, they're international champions and role models in their country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - The players used to be shy about playing sports as women using wheelchairs. Today, they're international champions and role models in their country. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/01/540910077/afghanistan-s-female-wheelchair-basketball-wins

item.title: 'I Was Somebody's Mother': Reflections On The Guilt And Grief Of Miscarriage
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Ariel Levy was five months pregnant and alone in a hotel room in Mongolia when she gave birth. Her son lived only 10 minutes. Afterward, Levy was haunted by the notion that she had caused his death.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Ariel Levy was five months pregnant and alone in a hotel room in Mongolia when she gave birth. Her son lived only 10 minutes. Afterward, Levy was haunted by the notion that she had caused his death. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/01/540822381/i-was-somebodys-mother-reflections-on-the-guilt-and-grief-of-miscarriage

item.title: Drug Puts A $750,000 'Price Tag On Life'
item.description: August 1, 2017 - The high cost of Spinraza, a new and promising treatment for spinal muscular atrophy, highlights how the cost-benefit analysis insurers use to make drug coverage decisions plays out in human terms.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - The high cost of Spinraza, a new and promising treatment for spinal muscular atrophy, highlights how the cost-benefit analysis insurers use to make drug coverage decisions plays out in human terms. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540100976/drug-puts-a-750-000-price-tag-on-life

item.title: Planning To Watch The Eclipse? Here's What You Need To Protect Your Eyes
item.description: August 1, 2017 - A total solar eclipse is one of the most magnificent sights you can ever see. But you need the right kind of eye protection, and some of what's being sold out there isn't safe.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - A total solar eclipse is one of the most magnificent sights you can ever see. But you need the right kind of eye protection, and some of what's being sold out there isn't safe. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/01/540661570/planning-to-watch-the-eclipse-heres-what-you-need-to-protect-your-eyes

item.title: This Doctor Was Ready To Have Her Baby When She Delivered Another
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Dr. Amanda Hess was about to give birth when she heard a woman wailing in pain. The on-call doctor was on break, so Hess delivered the woman's baby. Her own contractions started a few moments later.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Dr. Amanda Hess was about to give birth when she heard a woman wailing in pain. The on-call doctor was on break, so Hess delivered the woman's baby. Her own contractions started a few moments later. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540755123/this-doctor-was-ready-to-have-her-baby-when-she-delivered-another

item.title: Sen. Sanders Urges A Medicare-For-All Health Plan
item.description: August 1, 2017 - NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with Sen. Bernie Sanders on his plans to push forward with a bill for a single-payer health insurance system, in the wake of Republican failures to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with Sen. Bernie Sanders on his plans to push forward with a bill for a single-payer health insurance system, in the wake of Republican failures to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540755130/sen-sanders-urges-a-medicare-for-all-health-plan

item.title: Trump's Threat To Cut U.S. Payments Raises Uncertainty In Health Insurance Market
item.description: August 1, 2017 - The U.S. government is scheduled to make large payments to health insurance companies to help offset discounts required by the Affordable Care Act. President Trump has threatened to stop the payments.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - The U.S. government is scheduled to make large payments to health insurance companies to help offset discounts required by the Affordable Care Act. President Trump has threatened to stop the payments. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540755109/trumps-threat-to-cut-u-s-payments-raises-uncertainty-in-health-insurance-market

item.title: Senate To Hold Bipartisan Hearings To Stabilize Insurance Markets
item.description: August 1, 2017 - A Senate committee will hold hearings on stabilizing the Obamacare markets in 2018. The chair called on President Trump to continue payments to insurers that help lower costs for low-income people.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - A Senate committee will hold hearings on stabilizing the Obamacare markets in 2018. The chair called on President Trump to continue payments to insurers that help lower costs for low-income people. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/01/540656651/trumps-tweets-threaten-to-destabilize-insurance-markets

item.title: Country Music And Brain Research Come Together At Nashville Summer Camp
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Researchers in Nashville are tapping into a country music camp to learn more about Williams Syndrome, a rare genetic disorder. Many people who have it love music but don't know why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Researchers in Nashville are tapping into a country music camp to learn more about Williams Syndrome, a rare genetic disorder. Many people who have it love music but don't know why. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/31/540553819/country-music-and-brain-research-come-together-at-nashville-summer-camp

item.title: Scientists Edge Closer To Elusive Lab Test For Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Stanford University scientists have found an array of proteins in the blood whose levels correlate closely with the severity of symptoms of the mysterious illness that's increasingly known as ME/CFS.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Stanford University scientists have found an array of proteins in the blood whose levels correlate closely with the severity of symptoms of the mysterious illness that's increasingly known as ME/CFS. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/31/540565526/scientists-edge-closer-to-elusive-lab-test-for-chronic-fatigue-syndrome

item.title: Why We All Scream When We Get Ice Cream Brain Freeze
item.description: July 31, 2017 - When temperatures soar, there's nothing like a frozen treat to take off the edge. But if we dive in too fast, our brains are thrown for a distressing and sometimes painful loop. Here's why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - When temperatures soar, there's nothing like a frozen treat to take off the edge. But if we dive in too fast, our brains are thrown for a distressing and sometimes painful loop. Here's why. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/31/540062185/why-we-all-scream-when-we-get-ice-cream-brain-freeze

item.title: Arizona Republican Hopes Senators Can Work Together On Health Care
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Sen. Jeff Flake says he hopes for bipartisan cooperation on health care after last week's failure to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Sen. Jeff Flake says he hopes for bipartisan cooperation on health care after last week's failure to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/540515353/arizona-republican-hopes-senators-can-work-together-on-health-care

item.title: A Hospital CEO Watches Washington Struggle Over Health Care
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Northwell Health has a huge stake in what health care legislation Congress proposes. CEO Michael Dowling says it's time for Democrats and health care professionals to come to the table.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Northwell Health has a huge stake in what health care legislation Congress proposes. CEO Michael Dowling says it's time for Democrats and health care professionals to come to the table. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/540515360/a-hospital-ceo-watches-washington-struggle-over-health-care

item.title: Sperm Counts Plummet In Western Men, Study Finds
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Data from nearly 43,000 men around the world found that sperm counts dropped by more than half in Western countries. It could reflect a decline in health overall, scientists say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Data from nearly 43,000 men around the world found that sperm counts dropped by more than half in Western countries. It could reflect a decline in health overall, scientists say. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/539517210/sperm-counts-plummet-in-western-men-study-finds
